subject: remove some bt enable checks
commitMessage:
remove some bt enable checks

bluetooth adapter doesn't need to be powered on for gettting
adapter properties.

Remove those checks allows to retrieve adapter properties from
tizen.bluetooth.getDefaultAdapter() Web API call even if adapter
is powered off.

It helps to fix TC-1994.

Change-Id: If41ca8ac5a23a73c22e776cf2a19e4c4b0a819c9
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message: Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated

Patch Set 2: Verified+1

I understsand this is again a change in bluetooth-frwk logic. This fix is the continuity to the fact that bt-service doesn't enable bluetooth when starting.

Patch Set 2:

If you can add the mobile Marco is for it, It will be good.

Patch Set 2:

Adding __MOBILE__ macro is a non sense to me.
This patch just allows to get adapter name and adapter address if adapter is off.
If I add macro, there would be some problems using Bluetooth Web API.

About OSP part, it should not be there in Tizen 3. I won't set it between macro.

Patch Set 2:

If you add macro, I can't find that there would be some problems using Bluetooth Web API.
I can't find how tt should impact the web API.

>Just about OSP part, it should not be there in Tizen 3.
Maybe, you are right.
Let's think about the issue of OSP and different platform after Tizen-2.3 is merged.

The current code should support Tizen-IVI 14.4.
After Tizen-2.3 is merged, let's start to check different platform support carefully.

Patch Set 2:

>> If you add macro, I can't find that there would be some problems using Bluetooth Web API. I can't find how tt should impact the web API.

Bluetooth Web API defined in Crosswalk WRT offers tizen.blueototh.getDefaultAdapter() API to retrieve adapter properties. I have a pending commit allowing to retrieve such information in Crosswalk github depending of this patch. TC-1994 requests for keeping bt status in Modello between reboots. So this patch is relevant for Tizen IVI but also for all profiles using Crosswalk WRT (Tizen 3).


Btw thanks for the '+2'. But the code was not merged...
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: fix destroy bonding device use case
commitMessage:
fix destroy bonding device use case

9319c8 "add device disappear event" commit brings a regression.
It added a logic of storing paired device in glist which is not good and check
paired device in glist before sending a 'destroy bond' or 'disappear device' events.

It results that if a device was already paired before starting bt-service daemon,
the paired device was not listed in the glist and so 'destroy bond' event
was never triggered in case of unbonding request.

To fix it, let's consider that if device is present in glist, we trig 'disappear device'
event and otherwise we trig 'destroy bond' event.

Change-Id: I202cdeea48af7e3168c089c4164c7d7ef4711b2c
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

>It results that if a device was already paired before >starting bt-service daemon,
>the paired device was not listed in the glist
Not sure that when you run BT-Frwk, the paired devices aren't added by "InterfacesAdded" message?

If so, paired devices have been added to glist when you run BT-Frwk.

Patch Set 1:

How do you know that no any paired devices info in g_list?

Patch Set 1:

I noticed that when a device is paired when we boot the system, we can not unpair it calling destroy_bonding CAPI.

From my understanding, it means that the device is not in the glist because if it was added correctly to glist, it should be stored in g_list as a paired device. As paired property is checked before calling 'disappear' or 'destroy bonding' event, and as unpairing doesn't work in this case, it results that the device is not present in glist or is present but with a wrong paired state (but I don't think so). 

As you told me in the past, paired device should not be in g_list. I added it by mistake to handle disappear device event. But I think it is cleaner to do it like that : check if device is in g_list to send 'disappear device' event or 'destroy bonding' event.

Does it make sense ?

Patch Set 1:

After thinking, you probably right about the device is in g_list. The problem is that I update paired device status in g_list just when receving Paired device property changed event. So device should be there but with a wrong paired state.

Anyway, I think this approach (not having paired device in g_list) is better.

I don't see "InterfaceAdded" event when booting. So if a device is bonded, it is not in g_list.

In addition, after testing, I confirm that this patch fix a bug that when a device is bonded, it can not be unbonded after testing.

Now a changed power state is acknowledged in bluez event receiver.

to enable/disable bt adapter. Those scripts allows to also stop/start other Tizen

(Bluetooth-Frwk know the status of BT)

Patch Set 1:

> Why we need to modify the logic?
> What's the advantage of this method?

I did it for M14.3 IVI release because checking the adapter path in parsing dbus messages to know the adapter state brings a lot of latency.
I remembered that it took ~30sec to make tizen.bluetooth.getDefaultAdapter() returns in some cases.


Adapter path is always '/org/bluez/hci0' so pre-define it and directly use it improve performance a lot.

This logic can be applied to all profiles (Mobile included).

subject: keep current bluetooth state when starting bt-service
commitMessage:
keep current bluetooth state when starting bt-service

Previsouly when bt-service was started, it always tries to enable the bluetooth.
Therefore when the bluetooth is already enabled when starting bt-service,
it was not clean.

This patch allows to keep consistency between bluez and tizen bluetooth states.
By this way, if bluetooth is enabled when starting bt-service, bt-service just set vconf
and other variables. Following same logic, if bluetooth is down when starting
bt-service, we keep it down and align vconf status.

subject: add device disappear event
commitMessage:
add device disappear event

When BlueZ removes some scanned devices, it previously always trigs the
bond destroy event which is sent by API layer.

This fix consists of adding paired devices to g_list and verify paired
device status when removing device interface and so fire device disappeared
or bond destroy events.

This patch is combined with ea4787499cb21d2bfc744aad7b8ba103efe67845 from
platform/core/api/bluetooth API component.

It also removes static attribute from _bt_adapter_set_status() function in
order to update adapter power status in bt-service-event-receiver.

Change-Id: Idd7406b7add402689edaad06590f7c0b4a14bee5
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

subject: remove bonded device from glist
commitMessage:
remove bonded device from glist

It prevents from sending wrong paired/connected states to API
when scanning.

Change-Id: Icb12e5fff0af615d76c10071b19efbb7231afaf4
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

1. When bluez discovery the devices, bluetooth-frwk will get the devices from bluez.

Then bluez will remove the nopaired related devices after 3 seconds.

2. It is the solution of bluez discoverying.

3.Therefore, the bluetooth-frwk need to provide the list to save the related devices.

Patch Set 1:

1. Adding the list is for the bluez solution.

2. Therefore, you need to think about the other solution to fix your issue.

Patch Set 1:

@Wu: if the implementation is broken, why is this solution wrong?

Patch Set 1:

1.When you ask for bluez search the devices, if bluez never search devices, bluez will do it.

2.if bluez has searched the devices once, bluez will not search it and bluez think that upper layer has saved the search results. (The solution of bluez should be for saving power).

3.Only after 3 seconds, bluez will remove all found devices.

4.After then, if you ask for bluez search the devices, bluez will do it.

5.It means that sometimes bluez will not search devices and upper layer application need to save them.

6.It means that bluetooth-frwk need to save the related devices or sometimes, you will not find any devices by bluez.

Patch Set 1:

The list is "local" and not used for anything so why not to remove it?

Patch Set 1:

Hi,

The bug is the call to _bt_get_temp_remote_devinfo() after started discovery on bluez, which sends the device information from the glist to the CAPI.
But information in glist are not correctly updated (paired and connected status).

So for the IVI release I propose to totally remove the device glist.

Patch Set 1:

1. If you remove the glist, it will result in the other issues.
(You can't search and find the BT devices).

2. Paired and connected status is not right is the other issue.

3. You can remove the paired/connected device from the glist.

In the functions of __bt_parse_device_interface, 
"
XXXX
if (strcasecmp(key, "Paired"/"Connected") == 0)
{
  Remove the device from glist.
}
"
It should not send the wrong devices to UI.

What do you think?

Patch Set 1:

Actually, the correct device is sent to UI but with wrong paired/connected status because the status is not updated after pairing/connecting.

You probably right that the patch is not correct but it is sufficient for Modello UI.

I will try to correctly update devices g_list and let you know.

Patch Set 1:

Hi Zheng Wu,

After checking the device glist, current implementation makes that the bonded device callback is executed in bt-service-device.c (where there is no glist) and not in the bluez event receiver.c file. So this device property can not be updated properly in device glist.

I don't want to re-write all of the nearly old bluetooth-frwk...

Patch Set 1:

Hi Corentin,

You don't need to modify more.

You only need to remove the paired and connected devices from glists. and it matches bt search requirements.

In the functions of __bt_parse_device_interface,
"
XXXX
if (strcasecmp(key, "Paired"/"Connected") == 0)
{
Remove the device from glist.
such as: glist = g_list_remove(glist, device)
}
"
After then, It should not send the wrong devices to UI.

Patch Set 3: Verified+1

Hi Zheng Wu,
Sorry I misunderstood what you said yesterday.
Now it should be OK.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: do not retrieve adapter path from dbus message
commitMessage:
do not retrieve adapter path from dbus message

Every where, bluetooth-frwk checks the adapter state before doing an action.
Adapter state is retrieved from parsing dbus message from 'GetManagedObjects' method.
This is only needed to get adapter path from dbus message.
As adapter path is always '/org/bluez/hci0' using Bluez5, define it improves performance.

For example, it fixes a bug in Modello UI when getting default adapter with
bonded devices.

use bluez dbus api to enable/disable adapter

It was previously done invoking bluetooth-tools scripts.
For example, to disable adapter, one of the script kills bluez daemon process.

subject: adapt NTB to Tizen 3
commitMessage:
adapt NTB to Tizen 3

This patch aims to send popup data to notification-service.
Then a notification-service client is supposed to subscribe to bt_agent
notifications in order to display them and handle user replies.

This approach is not compliant with proposed bt_agent CAPI which is based
on dbus callbacks. It is not possible to catch new user popups by dbus
callbacks and by notification-service at the same time.
To use notification-service we need a synchronous bt_agent API for user
replies.

Change-Id: Ib38f7baf62b0d4c128df1700263bc4d9b2c36af6
Signed-off-by: Corentin Lecouvey <corentin.lecouvey@open.eurogiciel.org>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Yes sure, those lines have to be removed.

I sent this patch in draft mode because I need to know your feedback on the design. Let me share few questions :

- Is "COMMON" build flag is good ? May it is a confuse name...

- Is it preferable to create an other pairing.c file to handle notifications like that ?

- Should we add the bundle* parameter to  vertical_notify_bt_pairing_agent_on() function in all verticals even if it is not used ?

Patch Set 1:

>Is "COMMON" build flag is good ? May it is a confuse name...
Yes. It should be TIZEN_BT_XXX and so on.

>Is it preferable to create an other pairing.c file to handle notifications like that ?
It is not necessary.

>Should we add the bundle* parameter to vertical_notify_bt_pairing_agent_on() function in all verticals even if it is not used ?
At current, It is not necessary.

Patch Set 1:

Pair.c is common.

The platform related source code should be set in plugin(such as bluetooth-common.c).

Therefore, please don't add fill_notification_bundle in pair.c.

Patch Set 1:

Please don't modify the logic of pair.c

Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the review.

> Please don't modify the logic of pair.c
I didn't catch that last comment. Can you detail ?


Other question :
Is the 20s pairing timeout nice ?
I saw that BlueZ 5 has a 60s pairing timeout, but it is maybe too long to free the memory in our case...
Any opinion ?

Patch Set 1:

>Can you detail ?
1.In the function of handle_pairing_agent_method_call, if relay_agent exists, the handle_pairing will be invoked.

2.If relay_agent doesn't exist, vertical_notify_bt_pairing_agent_on will be invoked to lunch the BT_AGENT program.

3. BT_AGENT program will "RegisterPairingAgent" of pair.c in 5s.

4. If BT_AGENT program doesn't "RegisterPairingAgent" of pair.c in 5s, pair.c will invoke relay_agent_timeout_cb to remove the invocation.

5.After BT_AGENT program "RegisterPairingAgent" of pair.c in 5s, the invocation will be sent to BT_AGENT program.

6.Therefore, you don't need to add bt_pairing_agent_on(bundle* b) in bluetooth-common.c, only "RegisterPairingAgent" of pair.c is enough in BT_AGENT program.

7.Deal with the related invocation in B_AGENT program.

What do you think?

Patch Set 1:

>Other question : Is the 20s pairing timeout nice ? I saw that BlueZ 5 has a 60s pairing timeout, but it is maybe too long to free the memory in our case... Any opinion ?

We should match Bluez.

Patch Set 1:

> What do you think?

I think that's correspond to what is supposed to be done using bt_agent_xxx C API and dbus method invocations mechanism in BT_AGENT program. 

I'm not sure that this implementation is compatible with a notification-service client implementation. Because my BT_AGENT app (based on notification-service) can't be notified by dbus method calls but has to be notified by notification-service... The consequence is that I need a independant way to send back dbus reply to bluetooth-service, that's why I added a "ReplyConfirmation" method in bluetooth-service.

Btw, I will try to register an agent in my BT_AGENT (based on notifications) and keep as much as I can pairing logic...
I'll let you know...

Patch Set 2:

>The platform related source code should be set in plugin(such as bluetooth-common.c).

About that comment, I don't know how to properly move 'fill_notification_bundle()' function in plugin as it mainly depends on pairing.c... 

All of the plugins functions are defined in 'bluetooth_vertical_driver' structure. 
Should I add 'fill_notification_bundle()' ?
Shoudl I handle this with dlopen/dlsym ?
Any suggestion is welcome...

(4 comments)

Thanks for your review.

I added some comments.

Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

I added a comment.

Sorry I have encountered many problems with my test env today, and so I was not able to check this... I will reuse an older image tomorrow.

Can you add bt_agent_register_sync and bt_agent_reply_sync in macro of TIZEN_3?

Sorry, I had separated bt_agent sync API with TIZEN_3 flag in a local git branch...

subject: CAPI/Spp: Only unref Spp channel if socket is connected

CAPI/Spp: Only unref Spp channel if socket is connected

but not connected , g_io_channel_shutdown() should not be called with a null channel.
Otherwise we get this glib error :
GLib-CRITICAL **: g_io_channel_shutdown: assertion `channel != NULL' failed

comments.message:

Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Unless you happen to be working into the late hours tonight, I'll take a shot at changing the patch to pass in all the needed info for a callback via a bundle as I explained in my embedded comment

I'm still unit testing, but decided to go ahead and share.  We had a buildsystem issue where the wrt-plugins-tizen package was not getting built with the build options to turn on the bluetooth plugin, hindering my debugging efforts.

subject: BlueZ/Device: Attach device property changed callback function
commitMessage:
BlueZ/Device: Attach device property changed callback function

Property changed callback should be the device like BlueZ about each
device property.

CAPI don't define the behavior, state changed callback's invoking order,
Apps using CAPI set callbacks, could be before or after device created.
Using update function also set some callback that has already be set previously.
Instread of callback flag to indicate whether callback already be set or not.

subject: Set bt-core status to match IVI
commitMessage:
Set bt-core status to match IVI

On IVI, bluetooth is enabled defaultly.

Therefore, bt-core doesn't know the BT status.
It results in that bt-core can't close BT.

The patch will fix the bug on IVI.

Change-Id: Ic16b0430fe0cb65856b84e0e2f9f903ecf800cbe

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Yes, this is a good generic solution for this kind of dbus service.

However, for bluetooth-frwk, it's some kind of weird, it provides system-wide service but try to running with user privilege, this will fail in multi-user environment giving that there is only one system dbus-daemon, so the second login user will fail to register bluetooth-frwk service because there was one.

For more details, please refer to https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/PTREL-118

Generally speaking, if a service provides system-wide dbus service can running with non-root privilege, it's better to run as a specific user, rather than the login user, pulseaudio, the system wide dbus-daemon are good examples.

Patch Set 3:

BTW, I did submit such a FALSE change, see https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/#/c/7929/
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix dbus service file
commitMessage:
Fix dbus service file

There are quite several errors in the dbus service file.

* it's not necessary to export DBUS_SESSION_BUS_ADDRESS, dbus activation
  will do that, and more important, it's a totally wrong path, what's
  the $UID?
* do not touch system-wide log policy because in fact we can't. These
  debug settings are managed by dlogctl.

Change-Id: I0522fed5d5053a49884dc78ab4054d2dfa780b0e
Signed-off-by: Chengwei Yang <chengwei.yang@intel.com>

Patch Set 1:

In multi-user environment, app user shouldn't be used.

can we set "User=" to current user ?

if not, maybe systemd-user can help us.

Patch Set 1:

Hi Victor, I agree with you about the point of multi-user.

Setting "User=" to current user is the case of session bus, however, seems this is a system-wide service. Not sure which user is suitable for this service.

Patch Set 1:

bluetooth-frwk uses dbus session in order to talk with obexd.
(and to launch notification with libnotify/gtk popup system)

bluetooth-frwk-service is already set to be user specific as we can see in specfile (line 149):
%{_unitdir_user}/bluetooth-frwk-service.service

Patch Set 1:

Yeah, it's a systemd user service, when I was talking system-wide service I did mean dbus system-wide service. A simple grep did tell me that it's a dbus system-wide service.

However, thanks for your tip, I think it's a good point to change it to be a systemd activated dbus service. So whenever a dbus request to auto start it, it will be activated through systemd user session. So that's resolved multi-user issue perfectly.

Will submit the patch to do that soon.

any update? will pending for another two months?

subject: Fix permission denied on open dev node /dev/rfcomm
commitMessage:

The permission denied issue was due to early access to the /dev/rfcomm.
By adding a sleep time (10ms) and 3 retry, bt-service can now open this dev
node.

subject: Start bt-service with systemd user with multi-user option
commitMessage:
Start bt-service with systemd user with multi-user option

In multi-user environment bt-service cannot be launch by dbus-activation or
systemd-dbus activation.

- Add bcond_with multi-user option
- Add MULTI_USER_SUPPORT build option
- Remove rc.d/init.d in multi-user environment because done with systemd
user and  bluetooth-frwk-service scprit is for app user.
- Change dbus policy for multi-user
- Fix systemd unit file Install section
- Fix TZPC-4380

subject: Add a libnotify/gtk popup system to bluetooth-frwk.
commitMessage:
Add a libnotify/gtk popup system to bluetooth-frwk. 

This is helping having Bluetooth popups with no OSP application dependencies (bt-syspopup and osp-launcher) and libnotify/gtk on the patform.

	- Add bcond_whith bluetooth_frwk_libnotify in bluetooth-frwk.spec.
	- Add requires to bluetooth-tools needed for bt-core/bt_core.c (calls to /usr/etc/bluetooth/bt-*.sh)
	- Add compilation directive LIBNOTIFY_SUPPORT.
	- Remove  bt-syspopup dependencies with LIBNOTIFY_SUPPORT directive.
	- Modify bt-service/bt-service-agent.c in order to use bt-syspopup or libnotify (with compilation directive)
	- Add bt-service/bt-popup.c to display libnotify/gtk popups.
	- Add errno to bt-service/bt-service-rfcomm-client.c.

https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/TWFD-3


Signed-off-by: Victor Hakoun <victor.hakoun@eurogiciel.fr>

reviewer.name: Baptiste (DO NOT USE) DURAND (DO NOT USE)

However, bluetooth-frwk only is designed to support EFL and osp.

The furture verison of bluetooth-frwk will support to add new popup system easily.

The current version of bluetooth-frwk is difficult to add a new popup.

If possible, at best, using a new project(such as proifle/ivi/bluetooth-frwk) to implement to add a libnotify/gtk popup system to bluetooth-frwk.

subject: Fixes Tizen bluetooth device api fails to work for web apps TIVI-1275
commitMessage:
Fixes Tizen bluetooth device api fails to work for web apps TIVI-1275

- Fixes issue where calling any bluetooth device web apis will result in seeing "The name org.projectx.bt was not provided by any .service files" error.

- Moving the dbus service files for bt-core and bt-service to /usr/share/dbus-1/system-services/ so the wrt can activite the daemon.

- Change DBUS_SESSION_BUS_ADDRESS to use UID instead of user name.

- Added dbus policy conf files for bt-core and bt-service to add permission to run on the system, since the default policy blocks everything.

Change-Id: Iceb9a4a507f71dfa781c102030801b3d9c8353c7
Signed-off-by: Jimmy Huang <jimmy.huang@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If you modify this dbus path, in mobile environment the api will not work. (M0 / U1HD) I want to know,,,what is your environment. (Target device, Base Platform image)

Patch Set 1:

Then, I think you should use ifdef statement about the different environments. If you modify this value directly,,in the mobile target this change will occur some side effects.

Patch Set 1:

I was told that the mobile needs to switch to use user id instead of user name for Tizen 3.0 required by systemd.  The tizen-mobile-session is patched to switch to user id, see https://review.tizen.org/git/?p=profile/mobile/tizen-mobile-session.git;a=commitdiff;h=4a40aceceda00f0b954900c9cb6a785ddb7f4439, so this patch should not break mobile.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

The path modification is correct, UID's need to be used from now on (3.0 - all profiles), in all applications, including mobile. This doesn't *break* anything, it actually fixes everyone instead.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

ok, I agree this patchset in now. If systemd & dbus's auto-activation path will be changed in 3.0, this patchset also don't occur the side effect
